DataElement.preferredName: Immediate Family History Testicular Cancer Diagnosis Age 50 Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text that describes the age at which the family member was diagnosed with testicular cancer in relationship to their 50th birthday.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person related by descent rather than by marriage or law._Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)._Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones._A malignant tumor arising from epithelial cells.  Carcinomas that arise from glandular epithelium are called adenocarcinomas, those that arise from squamous epithelium are called squamous cell carcinomas, and those that arise from transitional epithelium are called transitional cell carcinomas.  Morphologically, the malignant epithelial cells may display abnormal mitotic figures, anaplasia, and necrosis.  Carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated.  Carcinomas invade the surrounding tissues and tend to metastasize to other anatomic sites.  Lung carcinoma, skin carcinoma, breast carcinoma, and prostate carcinoma are the most frequently seen carcinomas. -- 2004_Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person related by descent rather than by marriage or law.:Chronological record of health and disease events of family members and ancestors. (WEBS84)

Concepts.definition: A person related by descent rather than by marriage or law.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives. A patient's family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.:A malignant tumor arising from epithelial cells.  Carcinomas that arise from glandular epithelium are called adenocarcinomas, those that arise from squamous epithelium are called squamous cell carcinomas, and those that arise from transitional epithelium are called transitional cell carcinomas.  Morphologically, the malignant epithelial cells may display abnormal mitotic figures, anaplasia, and necrosis.  Carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated.  Carcinomas invade the surrounding tissues and tend to metastasize to other anatomic sites.  Lung carcinoma, skin carcinoma, breast carcinoma, and prostate carcinoma are the most frequently seen carcinomas. -- 2004:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

A malignant tumor arising from epithelial cells. Carcinomas that arise from glandular epithelium are called adenocarcinomas, those that arise from squamous epithelium are called squamous cell carcinomas, and those that arise from transitional epithelium are called transitional cell carcinomas. Morphologically, the malignant epithelial cells may display abnormal mitotic figures, anaplasia, and necrosis. Carcinomas are graded by the degree of cellular differentiation as well, moderately, or poorly differentiated. Carcinomas invade the surrounding tissues and tend to metastasize to other anatomic sites. Lung carcinoma, skin carcinoma, breast carcinoma, colon carcinoma, and prostate carcinoma are the most frequently seen carcinomas.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.: A number with no fractional part.::50: The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
